metadata.title: CVE-2021-3177 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Python 3.x through 3.9.1 has a buffer overflow in PyCArg_repr in_ctypes/callproc.c, which may lead to remote code execution in certainPython applications that accept floating-point numbers as untrusted input,as demonstrated by a 1e300 argument to c_double.from_param. This occursbecause sprintf is used unsafely.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3177` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.18-1~20.04.1
libpython2.7 - 2.7.18-1~20.04.1
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.18-1~20.04.1
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.18-1~20.04.1
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.18-1~20.04.1
python2.7 - 2.7.18-1~20.04.1
python2.7-examples - 2.7.18-1~20.04.1
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.18-1~20.04.1
No subscription required

idle-python3.8 - 3.8.5-1~20.04.2
libpython3.8 - 3.8.5-1~20.04.2
libpython3.8-minimal - 3.8.5-1~20.04.2
libpython3.8-stdlib - 3.8.5-1~20.04.2
libpython3.8-testsuite - 3.8.5-1~20.04.2
python3.8 - 3.8.5-1~20.04.2
python3.8-examples - 3.8.5-1~20.04.2
python3.8-minimal - 3.8.5-1~20.04.2
python3.8-venv - 3.8.5-1~20.04.2
No subscription required

idle-python3.9 - 3.9.5-3~20.04.1
libpython3.9 - 3.9.5-3~20.04.1
libpython3.9-minimal - 3.9.5-3~20.04.1
libpython3.9-stdlib - 3.9.5-3~20.04.1
libpython3.9-testsuite - 3.9.5-3~20.04.1
python3.9 - 3.9.5-3~20.04.1
python3.9-examples - 3.9.5-3~20.04.1
python3.9-full - 3.9.5-3~20.04.1
python3.9-minimal - 3.9.5-3~20.04.1
python3.9-venv - 3.9.5-3~20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.18-1~20.04.1').
python3.8 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.8.5-1~20.04.2').
python3.9 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.9.5-3~20.04.1').
